Reviews.Title: “This is absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatDane33
Reviews.Content: Location - Perfect Staff - Professional Room size - Fine Bathroom - Fine Only downside was the plastic they had chosen to place between the mattress and the bed sheet. I can only give this place my very best recommendation in case you are looking for a place to sleep in Rome at a fair price at a good location. It is seriously not more than 5 min. by foot from termini and even at night the area felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay while in Italy”
Reviews.Author: CatSinging10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at A&C Much More earlier than scheduled and Americano was very gracious to help us feel at home. He spoke English very well, even though my husband is fluent in Italian, so it was nice for me to understand. He volunteered to keep our luggage until the room was vacant and then move it into our room for us so we didn't have to haul it around until the room was available. He sat down with us and explained all the busing information to us along with the open hours of each site we were interested in. Each time we ran into him on our trip he was very kind and sincere in questioning us how things were going. Americano really recieves the Excellent rating. Our accomodations were perfect too. We felt very safe as we had 3 different keys to get into our room: one for the main street level door, one for the hallway door, and one for our room. There was free internet access with free wifi if needed. The facilities were just as clean or cleaner than most hotels I've stayed in the states. The room was quiet, with the window opening to a quiet courtyard, not the road. The bed was very comfortable and had a box spring underneath the mattress I believe. The 2 other hostels we stayed were just the mattress, and were actually 2 twins laying next to each other with a queen sheet. There was plenty of space in the room. Everything in the room was good quality. There is an elevator that works great for luggage that we used when we checked out. It was very handy. Our bathroom was right next to our room and I would honestly say it felt like we were the only ones in the building and had the bath all to ourselves. There was a second one just down the hall, but never needed to use it. The location of this hotel was perfect because it was on a quiet street and 2 blocks from any transportation needed, and you have to use transportation to see Rome. Walking it wouldn't be worth the time. A&C Much More was fantastic and we will be staying there again if we ever get to go back.

Reviews.Title: “More like lovely apartments than a hostel!”
Reviews.Author: linziharper
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over the Easter Bank holiday and thought it was fabulous. Staff were extremely nice and helpful and the location is great (near termini station and a short walk from a supermarket). We managed to do most of the city on foot except the vatican where we took the metro (very cheap- only 1 euro per person per trip). We stayed in a double room with a shared bathroom but didnt see anyone else around during our whole stay, so was like a private bathroom! would come back and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: HariniIyengar
Reviews.Content: 5 blocks away from Roma Termini. And very easy to find even by night. We were helped throughout our stay by Giuseppe, an elderly gentleman at the reception who greeted us with gusto every morning and evening and told us some wonderful stories about Rome and The Vatican City. Ask him to tell you the one about Michelangelo and the Pope when he was painting the Sistine Chapel if you have the time. Air con wasn't an issue with us as we stayed in Autumn bordering on Winter. The noise from the street can be a little loud at times unless you keep your windows closed..oh, and don't expect much of a view. Decent bathroom. I especially loved the literature available in the hotel if you want some night-reading and they always left us boiled sweets in the room. Those little touches went a long way in winning me over. Lots of restaurants pave the way to Roma Termini, so dining shouldn't be an issue. Security highly rated. And I can hardly praise the service more. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JudyCecil
Reviews.Content: Great place, very friendly/helpful staff and good location, very clean. Only minor downsides were the AC was on a set timer and didn't seem to work that great. Also the wifi signal was very weak in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lodgings with Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: MEK0869
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at A & C Much More. The hotel was convenient for our 2-week stay--located 5 blocks from Termini Station--and cost effective. Given that we paid $89 per night, my expecations, to say the very least, were not high. However, upon entering the premises, we were both extremely surprised. The accomodations--and staff-were absolutely lovely. The hotel offered terrific accomodations--a spacious room, full size bathroom, delicious breakfast, hospitable staff, and excellent location--that certainly exceed the price we paid. I would--without a doubt--stay again at A & C and recommend the hotel to anyone who is planning to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeopoldButters
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights and found the location perfect as it was close to the main train station which also connects the two metro lines. There are some cheap places to eat and a bar across the road in a hostel which is good fun. if you are looking for a romantic weekend away this place and area may not be the place for you but if you are looking to explore Rome and may be pushing on through Italy by bus or train the location is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: voitja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AC&More for 3 nights and could not have had a better experience. Americo was wonderful and gave us all the insider scoop. He helped us map out our 3 day stay in Rome and even ordered a private taxi for us to take to the airport for our VERY early flight. Spotlessly clean. And we loved the Yellow bar across the street! We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “You can't find a better value”
Reviews.Author: steve15182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and had a great time. The hosts were very helpful and friendly (complementary bottle of Prosecco for New Year's Eve!) and our room was well cleaned every day. The shared bathrooms were spotless which was a big relief since shared bathrooms can be so dreadful sometimes. The walls are a bit thin The area is extremely convenient to Termini Sta. which is critical if you have a early morning or late night flight. Plenty of food options in the neighborhood if you don't feel like venturing deep into the city. Although, I will mention we witnessed IV drug use on the sidewalk just a few blocks away... someone was kind enough to point this out to us so we had time to cross the street. Breakfast was light and simple, but at least you don't have to leave for the day on an empty stomach. All in all, A&C is a fantastic value and we could have easily spent twice as much for lesser accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Had some problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbn01
Reviews.Content: When we arrived here we were greeted by a lovely receptionist who was very helpful, he gave us maps told us what we can do etc. The man they had on at night was quite strange and basically we did our best to avoid him. The room was fine, the free internet was great and there were quite a few restaurants and bars around so you didnt have to go to far to find some food. One problem we had was that we discovered some alcohol we had brought was missing from our bag after we had left. Of course we cant be 100 % sure that it was taken but it is now gone and I always make a point of checking around our room to make sure we havent left anything before we check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great loctation, Friendly Staff, Awesome!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aussies_go_walkabout
Reviews.Content: was impressed from the moment we arrived. Americo was extremely helpful and personable. Room, brilliant. Perfect location, especially when there is transport strikes every other week. Also, for younger couples, the yellow hostel & bar across the road was great to have a drink and chat to people. (our hotel was cheaper than the hostel). Overall, a real oasis and refuge when travelling for a long time. brekky in bed a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Laurak23
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were so lovely and nothing was too much trouble for them. The breakfast is very large and brought to your room and at convenient time. When we arrived we were given a map on Rome and sound advice for our stay about purchasing a Rome pass and whereabouts all the attractions were. Although the rome was quite basic it had all you needed for an excellent stay. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis near Termini”
Reviews.Author: couvergirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel really deserves top marks. To begin with, the staff are very kind and accommodating. They were really friendly and spoke excellent English (much as we'd like to be able to, we're hopeless at conversing in Italian). The room itself was very tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. We appreciated the wardrobe in which one could lock valuables, and the good water pressure in the shower. It was also very nice to have breakfast in the room. The area around the hotel offers a number of restaurants to choose from, and is only about a 5 min walk to Termini station (from there, exploring the rest of the city by metro is a breeze). Overall, there is nothing to complain about -- we really enjoyed our stay. One caveat which I offer to those who might be concerned about this is that this is not really a place to meet other travelers: we heard others going into their rooms but never saw another guest during our two night stay. You might call this blissful solitude, which can be invaluable in the nonstop chaos that is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayloverIpswich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend 23 - 25 February, and were absolutely delighted with our stay! The room was big enough for our needs, and spotlessly clean. The bathroom positively shone!! Although the pressure in the shower was not great, we were able to have hot showers. Breakfast delivered to your door, at a time to suit you, is adequate (hard boiled eggs/tea or coffee/hot rolls/jams & butter/melba toast and cake). It is wonderfully placed for exploring Rome, just 4 blocks away from the main rail and bus station (Terrivision drop off point from Ryanair flights), and the metro/buses. A tiny little drawback is that you have to pay cash on leaving, but if you are aware, then that's really no problem. The owners and staff were absolutely fantastic and eager to please and help with any queries. For a budget priced hotel in a major location (145 Euros for 2 people for 2 nights B&B), I would find this place hard to beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but could be better..”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver778
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and found it to be fine though slightly disappointing after reading such good reviews about it on Trip advisor. The positives are that the location is close to the main station and is generally quiet. This location means that most attractions in Rome are not within walking distance. While you do not hear alot of noise from the outside, it can be difficult to avoid hearing noise from the neighbouring rooms on occasions. Though the overall service and quality is sufficient, the rooms lack any tea or coffee making facitlies and the TV is very small with BBC world the only non-italian channel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: KevC
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for 4 night at the end of November and I would recommend it to anyone. It's a quiet place, more like renting an apartment than a hotel as there's no actual reception desk or anything, but there are a few small hotels in the same building (converted from apartments by the look of it) and it felt very homely and safe. It's on a quiet street, with a few bars and restaurants nearby, but it's only 2 blocks/5 mins walk from Termini station, where you can catch the Metro into the city. It's also not far to walk to busier streets, and about 30 mins walk will get you to the Colosseum via a few busy shopping streets and some lovely churches. Overall I thought the hotel was great and would definitely go back - we had a double room with a nicely modernised en-suite bathroom, and the maid came every day to clean the room. You get a small continental breakfast delivered to your room on a trolley at any time you choose between 7am and 9am, but it isn't very substantial so you may need to get a coffee and croissant once you're out on the streets too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: S_T_E_P_H_2000
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for four nights and I recommend it for everybody! We had a double bed room with an ensuite and it was very tastefully decorated. They served a continental breakfast straight to our room at whatever time we wanted. We had to leave VERY early on Monday morning so instead of serving us breakfast, they packed us a little bag to take. The people were so lovely! The building is easy to find, just be aware that there are a few hotels in the building and there is only a label next to the doorbell - look for the big light up sign saying Hotel Romae on the side of the building. It is a very safe area with a pretty decent bar across the road and a couple of restaurants in the street. It was very close to Termini Station (central) and the metro station. We walked most places though (take a good map). There awere take away maps provided and a few books on restarurant guides etc. The room was nice, quite and extremely clean! Plus, the bar fridge is very cheap compared to normal hotels. If we are ever in Rome again, I will definitely be going back! I would also recommend it to anybody wanting to stay in a an exceptional hotel at a fairly good price.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ek75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last september because of the good price and decent location. It was a very clean hotel with excellent service. It was run by a really nice couple who couldn't have been more helpful. In fact all the staff seemed very friendly. Its 2 minutes walk from a subway station and not far from termini either. There are shops nearby and its on a safe street, although I didn't find the restaurants around very good. If I was in Rome again I'd definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Tarkhisis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in a double with ensuite. The rooms were clean and quite. The staff were friendly and eager to offer advice and help. Breakfast is delivered to your room and the room is cleaned daily. It is a 5 minute walk to Termini station and we had no trouble walking back to the accomodation at 11pm at night. There are restaraunts on the streets surrrounding, so you will have no trouble finding a meal and there was a mini fridge in our room. They even let us store our luggage before our flight home. The only problem I had was that I had to pay with cash.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MiaL
Reviews.Content: An excellent place to stay! Great location, spotlessly clean rooms, friendly staff. The breakfast was delivered to our room each morning. A wonderful way to start the day! The hotel is located a quick five minute walk from the main train and metro terminal. It's also only about a 20 minute walk to the main attractions. Would DEFINITELY stay here again. Several excellent restaurants in the immediate area. The air conditioning provided a much needed refuge from the Roman July heat. We had a lovely time in Rome. Hotel A&C Much more really contributed to our positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fab place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a fab cheap place to stay in rome, the rooms are large and spotlessly clean, we had a shared bathroom which was also spotless. The hotel is in a fantastic location, would stay there again. One of the best bits - they bring breakfast to you in your room!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: A&C Much More
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro 49 | reception 2nd floor, 00185 Rome, Italy
